document: Dear Editor, I believe that having computers in our homes is important because they provide access to vast amounts of information, allow us to save important files, and enable communication with people who are far away. With a computer, you can easily search for information on various topics, such as people's lives or specific subjects being studied in school or work. Additionally, computers can be utilized to save important files, including reports, pictures, and favorite websites. The ability to communicate with people who are far away is another advantage of computers. This can be done through email, social media, video chat, or online meetings. Overall, I think that computers are a great asset due to their ability to provide access to information, save important files, and facilitate communication.

My family says I should focus on school, spend time with them, and play sports. Many kids spend too much time on the computer after school. It's important for students to show appreciation to their parents and spend time with family. They should also put more effort into schoolwork instead of spending hours on social media. Only a small percentage of students use the internet for research. Many students struggle to complete homework on time. Students also need to exercise more instead of being lazy and spending all their time on the computer.

Dear @CAPS1 of @ORGANIZATION1, 
There is a debate on whether computers are good or bad for people. Some people think they are good because they can teach hand-eye coordination, help people learn about faraway places, and allow people to interact with friends. However, excessive computer use can have harmful side effects, such as obesity, red eyes, and cyberbullying. Many people who use computers too much are unhealthy and spend less time exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with family and friends. Computers are a major contributor to the obesity problem in @LOCATION1. They are also damaging people's eyesight, with some people experiencing strain and even blindness after only an hour of computer use. Cyberbullying is also a major problem, which can be experienced through video chat and messaging apps. I hope you will consider writing an article on this topic because computers are causing a variety of problems for society's health and mental well-being.

Do you sometimes lose track of time while using the computer? Spending too much time on it keeps you from being outside, spending time with family, and using other ways to learn. Sitting in front of a screen all day can lead to being overweight and missing out on nature. It's better to go outside, play sports, and have family time. People grow up quickly, so it's important to cherish every moment with them. Using books or visiting locations is a good way to learn, have fun and take memorable pictures. Spending less time on the computer leads to a happier life.

Hello, 

I believe computers have more advantages than disadvantages. They are great for learning and researching. If someone uses the computer too much, it is a personal issue rather than a social one. Computers are faster, easier, and more efficient than traditional research tools like encyclopedias or dictionaries. They are convenient and offer more opportunities to access information. Computers are important for our society and have changed our world in many positive ways. Without computers, our world would be different. 

Thank you for reading.

Dear editor of @LOCATION2 @CAPS1, I believe computers are ruining society in @LOCATION3. Many people spend too much time on computers, which can cause obesity and limit interactions with friends and nature. Americans go on computers for an average of @NUM1 hours per day, leaving little time for outdoor activities. National park attendance is declining due to the growing influence of computers. The use of computers also contributes to a lack of exercise among the public. Children who spend more than @NUM4 minutes on their computers are @PERCENT2 likely to be obese. Family and friend interactions have also been affected, with many people preferring to communicate through electronic means rather than face-to-face communication. I fear that computers will eventually take over @LOCATION3, and we need to stop it now. Thank you for your attention.

Dear @ORGANIZATION1, using the computer too much can affect people's lives. Many children spend their time playing games, using MySpace, Facebook, and checking email after school instead of doing other things. Computers are fine in moderation, but spending all day on them is not healthy. Adults should not allow their children to spend all day on the computer, and they should not do it either because it can harm their lives. There are risks to putting pictures and information on the internet that can affect one's future, such as in job applications. Instead of spending time on the computer, people can go outside to do sports, learn new things, or plan family trips. Children's lives can also be affected by things they post on the internet, as it could lead to bullying or fights with others. Parents should be aware of sex offenders using the internet to deceive children or adults, and fake pictures can be used to lure them. It's important to be careful and not let computers negatively impact one's life.

Dear local newspaper, many people spend too much time on computers and neglect important aspects of their lives such as exercising, enjoying nature, and spending time with family. This can lead to health problems such as poor bone health and obesity, environmental concerns such as not recycling, and a lack of meaningful relationships with loved ones. It's important to prioritize these aspects of life over excessive computer use.

Dear @LOCATION1, I think that computers are beneficial to society. There are three main reasons why: they help us store important documents, learn foreign languages, and obtain information. Without computers, storing important documents would be time-consuming and there wouldn't be enough space. Moreover, computers can help us learn foreign languages and communicate with people from different countries. Finally, computers allow us to access information quickly and easily. Though some people might argue that computers prevent us from exercising, enjoying nature, or spending time with family and friends, we should also consider the many benefits that computers offer.

Hi @CAPS1, some people argue that the increasing use of computers doesn't benefit society. However, others, including myself, believe that they have a positive impact. Computers teach hand-eye coordination, allow you to learn about faraway places and people and communicate online with others. There are three reasons why we should benefit from computers. Firstly, they help improve hand-eye coordination, which allows for activities such as catching and hitting balls. Secondly, computers enable access to information about different locations and people, without the need to physically travel. Lastly, online communication offers the opportunity to connect with others from all over the world. Therefore, computers are important because they provide us with many benefits that would not be possible otherwise.

Dear local newspaper, Most people in our community own a computer. This shows that computers must have a good impact on people. I think computers are positive because they allow you to communicate with others online, learn new things easily, and improve hand-eye coordination. Firstly, computers are valuable because they give you the opportunity to communicate with people on the internet, even if you don't have a phone. It's simple to reach out if you need to. Moreover, people can use computers to stay in contact with family and friends who reside in different countries, and it's not as costly as long-distance calling. Keeping in touch with others is beneficial, and computers help with that. Secondly, computers enhance one's knowledge by offering a simple way to learn new things. It's no longer necessary to travel to gain new knowledge since one can learn virtually anything with the click of a button. With this in mind, people can learn more because they have more time to do so. This is significant since the more people learn, the better their future prospects will be. Finally, computers can enhance hand-eye coordination, which is essential for everyday activities such as driving and writing. Using computers helps people learn eye-hand coordination in a way that lasts their lifetime. In conclusion, I believe computers have a positive influence on people because they enhance communication, knowledge, and hand-eye coordination. Thank you for considering my views.

Dear local newspaper, I believe people should limit their computer usage. They should spend time with loved ones, exercise more and enjoy nature. Firstly, using computers keeps people indoors and deprives them of fresh air. They can go outside and observe wildlife if they are interested in studying it. Secondly, using computers causes physical inactivity leading to weight gain and laziness. One should take breaks and indulge in physical activities like walking, running, cycling or working out. Lastly, people should connect with family and friends instead of being glued to the computer. One can plan family outings and spend quality time with loved ones. Excessive use of computers can lead to isolation and depression. In conclusion, we must prioritize people over screens and enjoy the world beyond our devices.

Computers are useful because they allow you to talk to people and stay updated. You can chat with friends anytime, even if they live far away. You can also find new ideas and opinions about things you want to buy. Additionally, computers can provide the latest news and updates about anything, from school schedules to local events. Computers are a great tool for staying connected and informed.

Many people like to play video games and chat online, but they may not know about the harmful effects of a computer. For example, if you use a computer for too long it can overheat and stop working. Also, looking at the screen for too long can cause headaches and eye problems. Computers can be addictive and can make you less social. They can also change your personality and become a dangerous tool, especially for children who could access inappropriate websites. Therefore, it is important to be aware of the risks and find ways to limit computer use.

Dear local newspaper, I think computers are very helpful. They allow us to explore and do many things. Nearly half of all households own a computer. Computers help us with work, school, and even buying a house or car online. They are inexpensive and useful for looking up information, playing games, and staying connected with the world. Some things, like playing Xbox Live and certain homework or college requirements, can only be done on a computer. Although some people waste time on computers, they save time and make things easier. I believe that computers are very beneficial and versatile. What do you think?

Dear all, Computers have become a dominant force in our lives. We use them for news, music, shopping and entertainment. However, there are serious drawbacks to this technology. Firstly, people's lives are becoming dominated by computers, preventing regular exercise. Secondly, personal interactions are decreasing as computers become popular. Lastly, computers are expensive and require much upkeep. It's essential that we address the harmful impacts of computer use. We must prioritize our physical health, social interactions and financial well-being over the convenience of our gadgets.

Dear @PERSON1, 

I have heard that some people believe that technology, like computers and gadgets, is bad for us. I agree with them because it affects our daily exercise routine, outdoor activities, and how we interact with loved ones. Due to technology, people are often distracted and avoid exercising, leading to an unhealthy lifestyle. This would be a problem, especially for young people, as we are the future, and an unhealthy society will suffer. Furthermore, studies show that exercising outdoors leads to increased energy levels and happiness, unlike computer use, which has been shown to cause headaches and fatigue. 

We should encourage people, especially young ones, to spend more time playing outside instead of relying on technology too much. Parents can monitor their children by making them play outdoors with other kids. This will help them develop their natural instincts while avoiding overreliance on technology. 

Another issue with technology is that it has reduced human interactions with others. These days people use texting, video calls, or chat to communicate. This may not be helpful as it could affect our ability to converse in real life. Moreover, families that rely on technology as their primary way of communication may harm their relationship. 

In my opinion, using technology often is not recommended. Therefore, we should limit our usage and go outside, spend time with others, and enjoy nature. 

Thank you for your time.

Dear local newspaper,

I want to ask if spending too much time on the computer is a good thing. I think computers are beneficial because they help people learn and keep in touch with friends and family who live far away. Students can use the internet to search for information and find answers to questions. Having access to computers can help people stay connected and informed. The computer is also convenient for storing and organizing information, making people more productive.

Thank you for considering my essay for your newspaper.

Dear Newspaper, I think computers have both positive and negative effects on people. On the one hand, you can learn about places without visiting them and gather information about countries, such as food, goods, and jobs. On the other hand, computers can also be a problem as kids might spend too much time chatting or playing games on them instead of going outside to play or attending sports practices. Moreover, talking to people on computers can lead to bad consequences, as people might not always be who they claim to be. So, if I had to choose whether computers are helpful or not, I would choose not. Computers are not helpful because many bad things could happen from tiny mistakes like putting your name, address or picture on the computer.

Dear @CAPS1, I have noticed you are worried about computers. However, I wanted to let you know that computers are actually very beneficial. They can assist in improving hand-eye coordination through various online games. Additionally, you can explore different locations and learn about people through your computer. Finally, computers enable communication with loved ones through various online platforms. Overall, computers are a valuable tool that we should appreciate and continue to use.

Dear residents of @LOCATION1,

I've noticed there's been talk about whether computers are helpful or not for society. I believe computers are a useful resource that make everyday life easier. They help with learning and improving grades, and serve as a great teaching tool.

One way computers assist with learning is by making it easier to find information. For instance, instead of spending a lot of time looking for sources in a library, you can easily search online and find what you need in seconds.

Computers can also be helpful for improving grades. Websites like Edline make it easy for teachers to post grades quickly. This helps students stay on top of their progress and know exactly what they need to work on, which can lead to better scores on assignments and tests.

Finally, computers are great for teaching, too. Videos on platforms like YouTube can make explanations of complex topics easier to understand, and email allows for quick communication with other teachers.

I hope you now recognize the benefits of using computers in our community.

Dear Newspaper, 

I disagree with the statement that computers are not important. Computers help with hand-eye coordination, allow for learning about far away places and keeping in touch with family and friends. Football players have good hand-eye coordination because they play games and use computers to update their status or play games like ping-pong. With computers, we can learn about places without visiting the library. It's also easier to stay in touch with family who live far away through online conversations instead of travelling long distances. In conclusion, computers are amazing because they help with hand-eye coordination, learning, and social connection.

Dear Newspaper, 

I read your recent article about how computers and the internet are affecting society. In my opinion, they are helping because I have learned how to do things quickly and efficiently online, such as clearing out debris properly. This is important because doing it the wrong way can be dangerous. The internet can also be helpful in emergency situations when finding family members is crucial. 

Although computers can affect how we exercise, there are pros and cons. The internet provides information on healthier and more effective ways to stay fit, but there are also negative effects such as becoming addicted to technology or experiencing increased body heat. However, these negative effects are only a problem if you don't use the internet responsibly. In conclusion, it's important to use technology wisely to improve our health and well-being.

Dear Local Newspaper, I believe computers have a positive impact on people. Firstly, students away from family use computers to keep in touch, like my sister. Also, people get sale alerts through email and save money. Research shows night use of computers enhances alertness. Secondly, the internet helps people learn about safe places to travel or study. For example, different colleges and their campuses. Finally, typing has advantages, improves coordination, and brings better educational outcomes. In conclusion, after reading this, I hope you can agree with me that computers have a positive impact.

I think computers can have a negative impact on people because they can become addictive and take up too much time. This can lead to health problems such as arthritis and seizures. Some experts believe that computers are causing obesity and that computer games can be particularly addictive. Using computers excessively can also make people feel depressed and isolated. It's important to remember to spend time away from the computer and appreciate nature. Additionally, computers can be expensive, especially when paying for things like online games and internet bills. Overall, while computers can be useful, it's important to use them in moderation and prioritize other things in our lives.

Dear Newspaper, 
I forgot the meaning of a homework problem and don't have my notes. A computer could help by quickly finding information. Access to a computer is helpful to find information, connect with friends, and fight boredom. With advanced technology, we can communicate and connect with people worldwide. Educational websites, games, and movies are readily available on the internet. A computer is a valuable tool for learning and having fun.

Dear @CAPS1, 

Computers are now a part of our daily lives. They can be used for many things like playing games, watching videos, browsing the internet, and even communicating with people from all around the world. They are very helpful for those who go to school because they allow you to complete and save your work. While some people may be addicted to using computers, others only use them when necessary. Computers can have a significant impact on people's lives. Sitting on a computer all day can be both harmful and informative. One of the informative benefits of using a computer is learning new information every time you use it. That is why I think computers have a great effect on people.

Dear North Courier, I would like to share my opinion on computers. I think they have a positive impact on people as they improve hand-eye coordination, provide access to knowledge, and allow for communication. Hand-eye coordination is important in sports and driving, and using computer games like Lumosity can help train and develop this skill. Computers also provide a way to learn and gather information about various subjects using search engines like Google. Additionally, computers offer communication options like instant messaging and email, which can be especially helpful for those without phones or for long-distance communication. Overall, I believe computers have many positive effects on society.

Dear [Name], I believe that people spend too much time on computers. I have three reasons for this. Firstly, people waste money on them. Everything you can get from a computer can also be found in books. Secondly, the constant use of computers means having to pay high electricity and internet bills. Finally, the world is facing a crisis and people are becoming less active because of computer use. It is causing a decline in physical fitness and contributing to the crisis. I hope this letter has shown you my perspective on this issue.

Dear Newspaper, 

Computers are not scary, they are helpful for many people, such as doctors, teachers, students, and scientists. They assist us in learning, communicating, planning trips, and finding information quickly. Using computers doesn't stop us from interacting with our families; we can stay in touch with loved ones through email. Computers are also eco-friendly, as they lead to less paper usage. They are constantly evolving with touch-screen technology, and they provide conveniences like medical records. Overall, computers are beneficial to our daily lives and will continue to shape our future.

Dear @CAPS1,

You asked in your newspaper if readers are for or against technology. I support computers because they help people learn about different cultures, save time, and allow communication with others online. For example, a man from the countryside who had never left his farm before was able to adapt to a new environment and find love with the help of a computer. Additionally, language students who use computers have higher success rates and better grades. Computers can also save time, like when a student was able to finish homework much faster with the help of an online dictionary. Lastly, computers allow people to communicate online, which is helpful for those who cannot leave their homes. Overall, I recommend that everyone invest in a computer for an easier life. 

Sincerely, 

[Your Name]

Dear local newspaper,

I agree with the experts who say that computers should be used. People need computers because they are important. Computers allow us to search fast and communicate easily. Many people have computers at home because we need them. Sometimes it takes minutes to find one word, but on a computer, you can find it in a second. Computers are important because some people do not understand something and need to look it up like stolen. If we have homework or need to learn about an important person, we can easily find the information on the computer.

Some people do not have computers at home, but they can go to a place to use them. We need to spend time with our families, but we also need computers for our future. Some people play games on computers, but they are also important for homework or jobs. For example, I want to be a police officer, and police officers use computers in their cars to search for information. 

I know most families want to be together, but we also need to think about our future. Computers help us in many ways, and we need them for the future. That is my opinion, and I hope you agree with me.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]

Dear local newspaper, 
I am writing to express my opinion about computers. I believe computers are great. For instance, we use them for school projects, and they help us make friends with people from other towns. Although the electric bill might be higher, it is worth it. You cannot simply assume computers are bad for us. Let me explain why we need computers for projects. Personally, my social studies teacher prefers typed final drafts. Besides, computers are helpful because they fix mistakes and help us find what we need. Computers also help us make new friends by providing an easy way to chat with people we meet online. Moreover, we can become more educated by searching for information on the internet. To sum up, computers are an easy way to learn and make new friends. Overall, I believe we should keep computers. Thank you for your attention.

Hello @LOCATION2 press, I wanted to share a fact with you. According to a recent university survey in @LOCATION1, @PERCENT1 of respondents agreed that using laptop and computers has great benefits in their daily life. I personally agree with this statement as it allows us to interact with people worldwide, help with school work, and simplify daily tasks. For instance, when I moved from @LOCATION4 to @LOCATION3, I was able to stay in touch with my family and friends through emails, instant messages, and video calls without incurring high costs. Using a computer also makes mom's life easier as they can order food and shop online. Although some may argue that excessive computer usage is detrimental, if used reasonably, it can greatly benefit us in keeping connections, simplifying daily tasks, and research for school. Thank you.

Computers have caused people to lose money, time and friends since they came out. Too much time on computers can cause people to lose time, money and friends. Spending too much time on them has a negative effect on people. However, computers can also have a positive impact. People in a certain location spend half of their day on computers and not getting exercise. This affects their friendships as well. It's best to limit time spent on computers so that people won't lose time, exercise or friends. A certain time limit on computers would be best for everyone.

Dear @ORGANIZATION2 editor, 

I am writing to share my opinion about whether computers are good or bad for society. I think computers are helpful for several reasons. Firstly, computers are a great learning resource that helps one stay updated with the world. Secondly, computers provide an easy way to stay connected with friends and family. Clearly, computers do more good than harm for people, and without them, life would be different.

Computers help us access information faster than ever. For instance, I can always look up something I need to know quickly, whether it's for @ORGANIZATION1 or my personal need. Thanks to Dr. @PERSON2's research from @ORGANIZATION1, it was found that high @ORGANIZATION1 students with computer access scored higher on standard testing due to background knowledge obtained online. @ORGANIZATION4 and @ORGANIZATION3 are some of the computer programs that help us learn new skills like language and writing.

Moreover, computers keep us updated with current events happening around the world. For example, when the @LOCATION1 earthquake took place, I saw it first on the news, but it only provided limited details. Later, I searched online to know more details like the death toll, the aid provided, and ways I could donate. Without computers, I would have been uninformed.

Lastly, computers help us to stay connected with others. Facebook and @CAPS2 are some tools that let me chat with people, invite friends, and plan parties quickly. Research conducted by @ORGANIZATION5 shows that @PERCENT1 of people on social networking accounts have more active social lives than those who don't. Dr. @PERSON1 suggests this means that such people will have an easier time adapting to different social situations.

In conclusion, computers are a great benefit to society as they keep us informed, help us learn, and most importantly, keep us connected. Therefore, computers are a very positive influence in our lives.

Dear Sir/Madam,

I believe owning and using a computer is beneficial for many reasons. Firstly, computers allow us to find information quickly and save time. Secondly, they enable us to connect with people from different places, and lastly, they help us to learn more about the world we live in.

With a few clicks, computers can provide us with information that we would have spent hours searching for in the library. Additionally, they allow us to talk to people from faraway places and even share videos and games with them. Moreover, we can use a computer to find out news, weather patterns, and learn about different cultures worldwide.

At the end of the day, computers are essential tools that improve our lives in many ways. Therefore, I urge you to consider the benefits of computers and their impact on society.

Sincerely, [Your Name]

Hi there, 

In today's world, everyone should use computers. Computers have a positive impact on people. They help with hand-eye coordination, let us learn about faraway places and people, and allow us to talk to others online. Today, computers are like a giant book of knowledge. You can find everything you need to know right in front of you. They're fast and easy to use, and everyone can use them. Kids are addicted to computers these days and spend a lot of time on websites like @CAPS1 and Facebook, where even ten-year-olds chat with friends and share pictures. You can also use websites that have webcams to talk to people from anywhere in the world. Overall, computers are a great way to get in touch with people, and everyone should have one at home.

You can use a computer to access the internet with just a click. Computers and the internet are recent inventions that are common in households. They have become popular in the last 20 years and greatly benefit society. Computers make it easy to learn and communicate. Life would be different without them. They provide access to information on almost any topic, with just a keyword search. You can copy and paste information you find and print it out. You can also communicate with people all over the world through email or social media, making it more convenient than scheduling phone calls. Computers have also greatly benefited the medical field, enabling doctors to perform surgeries and advance medical research. They have helped people achieve great things all over the world.

Dear Newspaper,

Over the years, there are less people outside exercising and enjoying nature. Is this a good or bad thing? Technology has advanced so far that sometimes it's better to stay home and use the computer instead of going to the park. Computers have positive effects because they have advertisements that encourage exercise, travel, and connections with people around the world. Firstly, advertisements on computers talk about exercise and joining a gym. Studies show that kids without computers have less exercise than kids with computers. Next, computers also have advertisements that encourage people to travel, which can increase intelligence and happiness. Lastly, computers allow people to connect with friends around the world, making them happier and less lonely. In conclusion, computers have a positive effect on people's health, happiness, and social life. Technology is here to make the world a better place.

Dear Newspaper, 

I believe that computers and the internet are extremely important for society. While some may argue otherwise, the invention has proven to be highly useful in schools and beyond, as long as it is used responsibly. While not everyone needs to own a computer, it has become a common luxury. The combination of a computer and internet offers easy access to vast amounts of information. Websites such as Facebook and Myspace allow for connecting with friends and promoting businesses. Additionally, the internet makes online shopping convenient, especially for those who dislike going to physical stores. Most schools nowadays have working computers with internet access, which has been a huge leap forward for education. Many websites are designed for educational purposes and cater to people of all ages. Teachers and students nowadays rely heavily on the internet for homework assignments and online tests. While there are downsides to the internet, such as the dark side of social media, the benefits outweigh the negatives.

"I think computers are useful because anyone can use them anytime to contact people or do things like play games, research, or work. They can also be helpful for school projects and saving information. People can even create their own websites or open accounts on existing ones. Overall, computers are very helpful for people who want to search for things they are curious about or use them for good purposes."

Dear Newspaper,

My opinion on computers is that they have a positive impact on people. People can exercise and learn on computers. Some people use them just to chat and explore new places. Computers also help people get educational degrees online, which is beneficial for single mothers and those with busy schedules. My friend @PERSON1 teaches me how to type, and there are plenty of educational resources online. All in all, computers are great for everything, from checking the weather to contacting teachers.

Sincerely,
@CAPS1

Dear @ORGANIZATION2, my name is @PERSON1 from @LOCATION3, @LOCATION2. I want to share my opinion on how @ORGANIZATION1 computer usage affects @LOCATION1, from a young teen's perspective. At my age, people rely heavily on computers. They use them for entertainment, communication with loved ones, and to stay informed about current affairs. While some individuals may not benefit from computer use, most of the time people are satisfied and benefit from it. 

Computers have a positive effect on people as they offer numerous entertaining and educational websites. For instance, I use @CAPS2 for online gaming, and my younger brother uses learning websites for hours. Additionally, experts suggest that individuals learn more from computer screens than textbooks or in-person instruction because it catches their attention. 

Computer use also helps people communicate with friends and family, such as my family does with my college-going brother through @ORGANIZATION4's video chat program. Sixty-three percent of poll respondents said they communicate via the computer the most. 

Finally, computers allow people to stay informed about world events. I always find breaking news on the internet whenever I open it. More than half of @ORGANIZATION3's students also say they receive news from the internet. 

Overall, computers have mostly positive effects on people, despite some negative impacts.

Dear @LOCATION1, I believe that the increasing use of computers has negative effects on people. First, using computers for long periods of time can harm your health. Sitting in front of a computer screen for hours can cause arthritis, and hunching over the keyboard can strain your back. Second, excessive computer use can cause people to neglect spending time with loved ones. For example, if you make plans with family but end up using your computer instead, your absence can hurt them. Finally, while computers can help you learn about different cultures and places, it's better to travel there or meet people from those places to experience it firsthand. Overall, in my opinion, excessive computer use poses health risks and can harm relationships. It's better to seek out new experiences in person than through a computer screen.

People spend too much time on computers. Being outside, playing sports, and traveling are better options. Some say you can learn about animals and plants on a computer, but being outside is the best way to learn. Outdoor activities can improve intelligence, hand-eye coordination, and physical strength. Traveling is also an excellent way to explore new places and languages. Overall, there is no comparison between computers and real life experiences.

I think computers are not good for people because they can make you less active and take away time from important things like family and friends. Spending too much time on the computer can also make you forget things and lose focus.

Hi @PERSON2, have you noticed how society has changed due to computers in the past ten years? While they bring benefits like messaging and information, they also take away from important aspects of life like fitness, nature, and family time. Spending too much time on the computer can be unhealthy and even cause weight gain. Unfortunately, computer lovers often neglect exercise and spend less time with family and friends. Nature is also being ignored more than ever due to technology. We need to recognize these problems and set aside time for exercise, enjoying nature, and family interaction daily in order to prevent their negative effects.

Dear newspaper, I believe computers have a positive effect on people for the following reasons. Firstly, they allow you to easily communicate with friends and family who live far away. Secondly, you can use them to search for information you need, such as for a report. Lastly, computers provide a platform for work, such as handling finances or preserving the environment. I hope you consider the positive impact of computers, which many people already enjoy.

I believe computers are good for people. People usually do not use computers for long periods of time. Computers are positive because they offer new technology that can help people when they are stuck or need information. People use computers for different things like school, meals, and activities. News companies also use computers to edit and print newspapers and to post news on their websites. Without a computer, people would have a hard time communicating with others who are distant. Many people use apps like Skype or ooVoo to stay in touch with faraway friends or family members. Computers can also help with school work, translations, and looking up definitions. They do not have a negative impact on people's lives or take away from what people should do in real life.

I believe computers are good for people and the world because they allow us to talk to people far away, teach us things, and help us be more social. With a computer, we can talk to family and friends through video chat and use websites like @CAPS2 to connect with people and share pictures and videos. Computers also offer programs that teach typing and reading, which can be helpful for both kids and adults. Lastly, computers let us be more social by allowing us to connect with people and learn about events happening at school or in the world. Overall, I think having a computer is a good idea.

Newspapers believe computers are essential in modern society. They aid learning, communication, and teach crucial skills. Students, like myself, use computers regularly for research and typing. Overall, computers boast many benefits for society and should be encouraged.

Dear @CAPS1 @CAPS2, Recently, there has been debate about whether computers are overused. I believe that although computers can be unhealthy if used excessively, in general, they are helpful. They also provide a popular form of communication, such as email and instant messaging, which is useful for communicating with others.

Computers can make life easier for adults too, as they can help with tasks such as paying bills, shopping, and job searching. Without computers, these tasks would require much more effort and time.

In conclusion, while some people argue that computers can be unhealthy, they generally do more good than harm. They help with education, communication, and make life easier for adults. I hope this explanation has made my point clear and you agree with me.

Hello Newspaper, I like computers a lot. They are helpful because they can teach us new things and offer fun games and websites. Dear local newspaper, 

What would we do without computers? I believe they are essential for connecting with family who are far away. With a computer, you can see and talk to them through a camera, just as if you were there.

Hi @PERSON2, your recent article on the positives and negatives of computers in our society was informative.
